gw.api.system.cluster

Interface BackgroundTaskLoadBalancingPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface BackgroundTaskLoadBalancingPlugin
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    Plugin that helps with dynamic load balancing of the long running tasks.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LoadBalancingResult rebalanceMessageDestinations(LoadBalancingContext context)
      Analyzes the message destinations started on the other servers and requests transfers to the current server if it is underloaded.
      LoadBalancingResult rebalanceMessageProcessors(LoadBalancingContext context)
      Analyzes the message destinations started on the other servers and requests transfers to the current server if it is underloaded.
      LoadBalancingResult rebalanceStartablePlugins(LoadBalancingContext context)
      Analyzes the startable plugins started on the other servers and requests transfers to the current server if it is underloaded.
      java.util.List<ComponentInfo> selectMessageDestinationsToStartNow(java.util.List<ComponentInfo> availableMessageDestinations, LoadBalancingContext context)
      Selects message destinations to start right now.
      java.util.List<ComponentInfo> selectMessageProcessorsToStartNow(java.util.List<ComponentInfo> availableProcessors, LoadBalancingContext context)
      Selects message destinations to start right now.
      java.util.List<ComponentInfo> selectStartablePluginsToStartNow(java.util.List<ComponentInfo> availableStartablePlugins, LoadBalancingContext context)
      Selects startable plugins to start right now.

    • Method Detail

      • rebalanceStartablePlugins

        LoadBalancingResult rebalanceStartablePlugins(LoadBalancingContext context)
        Analyzes the startable plugins started on the other servers and requests transfers to the current server if it is underloaded.
        Parameters:
        context - load balancing context
        Returns:
        load balancing result, must be not null.

      • rebalanceMessageDestinations

        LoadBalancingResult rebalanceMessageDestinations(LoadBalancingContext context)
        Analyzes the message destinations started on the other servers and requests transfers to the current server if it is underloaded.
        Parameters:
        context - load balancing context
        Returns:
        load balancing result, must be not null.

      • rebalanceMessageProcessors

        LoadBalancingResult rebalanceMessageProcessors(LoadBalancingContext context)
        Analyzes the message destinations started on the other servers and requests transfers to the current server if it is underloaded.
        Parameters:
        context - load balancing context
        Returns:
        load balancing result, must be not null.

      • selectStartablePluginsToStartNow

        java.util.List<ComponentInfo> selectStartablePluginsToStartNow(java.util.List<ComponentInfo> availableStartablePlugins,
                                                               LoadBalancingContext context)
        Selects startable plugins to start right now. The method allows to not start some components and give the other server a chance to start them. It allows to achieve more uniform load distribution. If a component start is delayed and no server starts it, the method will be call on this server again.
        Parameters:
        availableStartablePlugins - Startable plugins available to start.
        context - load balancing context
        Returns:
        selected components to start.

      • selectMessageDestinationsToStartNow

        java.util.List<ComponentInfo> selectMessageDestinationsToStartNow(java.util.List<ComponentInfo> availableMessageDestinations,
                                                                  LoadBalancingContext context)
        Selects message destinations to start right now. The method allows to not start some components and give the other server a chance to start them. It allows to achieve more uniform load distribution. If a component start is delayed and no server starts it, the method will be call on this server again.
        Parameters:
        availableMessageDestinations - messaging destinations available to start.
        context - load balancing context
        Returns:
        selected components to start.

      • selectMessageProcessorsToStartNow

        java.util.List<ComponentInfo> selectMessageProcessorsToStartNow(java.util.List<ComponentInfo> availableProcessors,
                                                                LoadBalancingContext context)
        Selects message destinations to start right now. The method allows to not start some components and give the other server a chance to start them. It allows to achieve more uniform load distribution. If a component start is delayed and no server starts it, the method will be call on this server again.
        Parameters:
        availableProcessors - message request processors available to start.
        context - load balancing context
        Returns:
        selected components to start.
